content: The Act titled "Law Enforcement Officers Safety Act of 2007" makes amendments to law enforcement officer safety provisions in Title 18. The Act "Law Enforcement Officers Safety Act of 2007" amends Section 926B of Title 18, United States Code, by redefining the term 'firearm' to include ammunition and accessories not prohibited by Federal law. It also specifies exclusions such as machineguns, firearm silencers, and destructive devices. The Act "Law Enforcement Officers Safety Act of 2007" amends Section 926C of Title 18, United States Code, by redefining the qualifications for law enforcement officers. It includes provisions for retired law enforcement officers who have completed at least 15 years of service with a public agency.
